statements: UPSERT INTO CloudComputingData (id, company_name, service_offered, location) VALUES (1, 'ABC Corp', 'Cloud Storage', 'New York')
UPSERT INTO CloudComputingData (id, company_name, service_offered, location) VALUES (2, 'XYZ Inc', 'Data Analytics', 'San Francisco')
UPSERT INTO CloudComputingData (id, company_name, service_offered, location) VALUES (3, 'PQR Ltd', 'Machine Learning', 'Chicago')

UPSERT INTO cloud_providers(provider_id, provider_name, headquarters_location) VALUES (1, 'Microsoft Azure', 'Redmond, WA') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE provider_name = 'Microsoft Azure', headquarters_location = 'Redmond, WA';
UPSERT INTO cloud_providers(provider_id, provider_name, headquarters_location) VALUES (2, 'AWS', 'Seattle, WA') ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE provider_name = 'AWS', headquarters_location = 'Seattle, WA';
UPSERT INTO cloud_services(service_id, service_name, provider_id) VALUES (1, 'Virtual Machines', 1) ON DUPLICATE KEY UPDATE service_name = 'Virtual Machines', provider_id = 1;
UPSERT INTO cloud_providers (provider_id, provider_name, location) VALUES (1, 'AWS', 'US')
UPSERT INTO cloud_providers (provider_id, provider_name, location) VALUES (2, 'Google Cloud', 'Europe')
UPSERT INTO cloud_providers (provider_id, provider_name, location) VALUES (3, 'Azure', 'Asia')

INSERT INTO instance (instance_id, provider, region, instance_type) VALUES (1, 'AWS', 'us-east-1', 't2.micro') ON CONFLICT (instance_id) DO UPDATE SET provider = 'AWS', region = 'us-east-1', instance_type = 't2.micro';

INSERT INTO storage (storage_id, provider, region, storage_type) VALUES (1, 'Azure', 'us-west-2', 'Standard SSD') ON CONFLICT (storage_id) DO UPDATE SET provider = 'Azure', region = 'us-west-2', storage_type = 'Standard SSD';

INSERT INTO network (network_id, provider, region, network_type) VALUES (1, 'Google Cloud', 'europe-west1', 'VPC') ON CONFLICT (network_id) DO UPDATE SET provider = 'Google Cloud', region = 'europe-west1', network_type = 'VPC';
